Definition: Agent executes predefined responses or simple rule-based logic without explicit reasoning chains
Agent employs chain-of-thought or sequential reasoning to solve problems through one deliberative pathway
Agent generates and evaluates multiple alternative reasoning paths, selecting optimal solutions through comparison
Agent iteratively improves reasoning through self-reflection or cross-agent verification, correcting errors and refining outputs
Agent operates solely through language generation without invoking external tools or APIs
Agent can invoke individual tools or functions but does not coordinate multiple tools in sequence
Agent coordinates multiple tools in planned sequences to complete complex workflows
Agent integrates with enterprise systems through standardized interfaces, managing authentication, access control, and cross-system workflows
Agent memory limited to current context window; no persistence across sessions
Agent maintains working memory across extended interactions within a session but no cross-session persistence
Agent stores and retrieves past experiences and interactions across sessions, enabling historical pattern recognition
Agent implements multiple memory types (episodic, semantic, procedural) with consolidation mechanisms for sustained learning
Agent operates independently without coordination with other agents
Agents organized in role-based hierarchies with designated planners, workers, and evaluators
Agents collaborate as equals through voting, debate, or negotiation mechanisms
Agents dynamically form and dissolve coalitions based on task requirements and capability matching
Agent acts only on explicit instructions, providing outputs for human decision-making
Agent executes defined workflows with human checkpoints and approval gates
Agent makes independent decisions within bounded domains, with human oversight for exceptions
Agent independently sets and pursues goals with minimal human intervention
Agent operates with fixed capabilities; no adaptation during or across deployments
Agent adapts behavior through prompt engineering, few-shot examples, or retrieval augmentation without parameter updates
Agent improves through verbal feedback, reflection, or environmental signals within deployment
Agent undergoes parameter updates or skill library expansion through fine-tuning, RLHF, or procedural memory accumulation
Agent produces outputs for human consumption without interactive collaboration
Agent engages in turn-based dialogue, responding to human queries and instructions
Agent provides explanations of its reasoning and decisions, enabling human understanding and oversight
Agent and human engage in mutual transparency, with shared mental models and collaborative decision-making
Agent operates without explicit policy constraints or alignment mechanisms
Agent configured with basic alignment guidance but no enforcement mechanisms
Agent operates within defined access controls, audit trails, and regulatory constraints
Agent demonstrates sustained alignment with organizational values through RLHF, constitutional AI, or ongoing governance oversight
No explicit safety mechanisms beyond base model training
Basic guardrails filtering harmful inputs and outputs
Agent tested for adversarial robustness with graceful degradation mechanisms
Multi-layered safety including guardrails, robustness, interruptibility, monitoring, and human override capabilities
